html: We cannot allow terrorists to regain control of Afghanistan.
text: We cannot allow terrorists to regain control of Afghanistan.

html: Our ongoing efforts in Afghanistan are necessary to ensure another 9/11 does not occur. With threats rising from ISIS-K and other terrorist groups, America’s presence in Afghanistan today is as important as it has ever been to protect the homeland and our allies.
text: Our ongoing efforts in Afghanistan are necessary to ensure another 9/11 does not occur. With threats rising from ISIS-K and other terrorist groups, America’s presence in Afghanistan today is as important as it has ever been to protect the homeland and our allies.

html: While we all want an end to America’s longest running war, it must be done the right way. Withdrawing half our troops from Afghanistan at this critical time is a major risk that would lead to greater instability and jeopardize America’s national security.

html: (3/3) Any hope left for the 2015 U.S.-China hacking agreement is over. As NSA official Rob Joyce stated, it is "clear that they are well beyond the bounds" of the deal. We need to strengthen our IT infrastructure and protect the U.S. government from Chinese intelligence schemes.
text: (3/3) Any hope left for the 2015 U.S.-China hacking agreement is over. As NSA official Rob Joyce stated, it is "clear that they are well beyond the bounds" of the deal. We need to strengthen our IT infrastructure and protect the U.S. government from Chinese intelligence schemes.

html: (2/3) We can no longer afford to ignore this treat. The Chinese government is not only hacking tech companies, but infiltrating our higher education institutions, and disrupting government IT infrastructure. If we continue to turn a blind eye, we as a nation will suffer greatly.
text: (2/3) We can no longer afford to ignore this treat. The Chinese government is not only hacking tech companies, but infiltrating our higher education institutions, and disrupting government IT infrastructure. If we continue to turn a blind eye, we as a nation will suffer greatly.

html: (1/3) I applaud the DOJ's charges against two Chinese nationals working with China’s intelligence agency. 45 tech companies and U.S. government agencies have lost critical data to the CCP. Even worse, the hackers have been stealing from the U.S. since 2006 https://wapo.st/2ScHwMB

html: As we celebrate #Thanksgiving, let’s not forget the many who are serving abroad in dangerous places so that we may remain free. I recall this being a particularly tough holiday to be away from family. Today I remain as grateful as ever for those who serve. #NeverForget
text: As we celebrate #Thanksgiving, let’s not forget the many who are serving abroad in dangerous places so that we may remain free. I recall this being a particularly tough holiday to be away from family. Today I remain as grateful as ever for those who serve. #NeverForget

html: On a personal note, this week marks 4th anniversary of the passing of SGM Turner, who was killed in suicide bomb attack outside our base. He was great man and leader, and his sacrifice will never be forgotten. I was glad to see the DFAC at @ResoluteSupport is named in his honor.
text: On a personal note, this week marks 4th anniversary of the passing of SGM Turner, who was killed in suicide bomb attack outside our base. He was great man and leader, and his sacrifice will never be forgotten. I was glad to see the DFAC at @ResoluteSupport is named in his honor.

html: When this President provides leadership on important issues, he succeeds (tax cuts, economy, rebuilding military). I strongly encourage him to turn focus more to Afghanistan so that history will show he was the President who successfully ended the longest war in American history.
text: When this President provides leadership on important issues, he succeeds (tax cuts, economy, rebuilding military). I strongly encourage him to turn focus more to Afghanistan so that history will show he was the President who successfully ended the longest war in American history.

html: The American people deserve to know how the South Asia Strategy is working and why our ongoing investment there is important. Either a visit by the President or a presidential address could go a long way to provide this update and assure public that this is too important to fail.
text: The American people deserve to know how the South Asia Strategy is working and why our ongoing investment there is important. Either a visit by the President or a presidential address could go a long way to provide this update and assure public that this is too important to fail.

html: I also repeat my earlier call for the Trump Administration to provide a serious progress report to the American people now that we are more than a year past the announcement of the South Asia Strategy.https://www.nationalreview.com/2018/10/afghanistan-war-american-public-deserves-progress-report/ …

html: While I’ve been agnostic on recent criticisms of President Trump for not visiting our troops, I do believe it would be helpful to him to better understand the evolving threats in Afghanistan if he saw the situation firsthand, and I will encourage him to do so.
text: While I’ve been agnostic on recent criticisms of President Trump for not visiting our troops, I do believe it would be helpful to him to better understand the evolving threats in Afghanistan if he saw the situation firsthand, and I will encourage him to do so.

html: Our ongoing efforts in Afghanistan are necessary to ensure another 9/11 does not occur. I remain committed to supporting these efforts and to seeing a successful conclusion reached there ASAP.
text: Our ongoing efforts in Afghanistan are necessary to ensure another 9/11 does not occur. I remain committed to supporting these efforts and to seeing a successful conclusion reached there ASAP.

html: Whether peace with Taliban is realistic or not, it is clear that the mission in Afghanistan of protecting the homeland persists with rising threat of ISIS-K and other groups that pose serious and imminent threats to Americans.
text: Whether peace with Taliban is realistic or not, it is clear that the mission in Afghanistan of protecting the homeland persists with rising threat of ISIS-K and other groups that pose serious and imminent threats to Americans.

html: After discussions with @ResoluteSupport @USambkabul and even @ashrafghani, it's clear that there is sense of optimism and reconciliation is within reach due to efforts of @us4afghanpeace and others. This gives hope to many as the recent ceasefire was evidence of some progress.
text: After discussions with @ResoluteSupport @USambkabul and even @ashrafghani, it's clear that there is sense of optimism and reconciliation is within reach due to efforts of @us4afghanpeace and others. This gives hope to many as the recent ceasefire was evidence of some progress.

html: After visiting troops and leaders on the ground in Afghanistan, I'm convinced our efforts there are as important as ever, as the level of threats has evolved in recent months, but after 17 years the American people are growing even more weary.
text: After visiting troops and leaders on the ground in Afghanistan, I'm convinced our efforts there are as important as ever, as the level of threats has evolved in recent months, but after 17 years the American people are growing even more weary.

html: While much has changed, too much remains the same in Afghanistan. It’s clear to me that the security situation has deteriorated even further since I was deployed there, and the Taliban has taken footholds in new parts of country since failed Obama strategy of drawdown 5 yrs ago.
text: While much has changed, too much remains the same in Afghanistan. It’s clear to me that the security situation has deteriorated even further since I was deployed there, and the Taliban has taken footholds in new parts of country since failed Obama strategy of drawdown 5 yrs ago.

html: Just left Afghanistan with a bipartisan Congressional delegation I led and wanted to share a few raw and unedited thoughts on my first trip back since being deployed there in 2014-15.
text: Just left Afghanistan with a bipartisan Congressional delegation I led and wanted to share a few raw and unedited thoughts on my first trip back since being deployed there in 2014-15.

html: After 28 years of Congress asking, the Pentagon released its first ever audit. html: In order to cut taxes for the middle class and American job creators, Republicans limited the SALT Deduction. Democrats now want to repeal this cap – more than half of which benefits the wealthiest – to raise taxes on everyone else. html: This morning I attended the #FW22 and spoke about my military service and bipartisan efforts in Congress to help our veterans. I’m thankful for all Fort Wayne 22 is doing to support those who served our country in uniform and win the war against veteran suicide.pic.twitter.com/C4y2SKLzHq
